1.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)

2.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
a plan, usually evil (machination), sometimes good (sagacity)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a dripping i.e. of honey (from the comb)
to ooze, i.e. distil gradually; by implication, to fall in drops; figuratively, to speak by inspiration
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness
properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing)

4.brief: the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity
bitter (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) bitterness, or (adverbially) bitterly
wormwood (regarded as poisonous, and therefore accursed)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

5.brief: a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
to sustain; by implication, to obtain, keep fast; figuratively, to help, follow close

6.brief: a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
properly, to roll flat, i.e. prepare (a road); also to revolve, i.e. weigh (mentally)
to waver, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively (as subjoined)
a track (literally or figuratively); also a rampart (as circular)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

7.brief: at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

8.brief: to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to approach (causatively, bring near) for whatever purpose
near, with or among; often in general, to
an opening (literally), i.e. door (gate) or entrance way
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

9.brief: properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, hinder; generally, next, other, etc.
grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance)
a year (as a revolution of time)

10.brief: properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
an earthen vessel; usually (painful) toil; also a pang (whether of body or mind)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
strange, in a variety of degrees and applications (foreign, non-relative, adulterous, different, wonderful)

11.brief: the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
flesh (as swelling out), as living or forfood; generally food of any kind; figuratively, kindred by blood

12.brief: properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
chastisement; figuratively (by words) correction, refutation, proof (even in defence)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

13.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
properly, to goad, i.e. (by implication) to teach (the rod being an Oriental incentive)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)

14.brief: a little or few (often adverbial or compar.)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre
a stated assemblage (specifically, a concourse, or generally, a family or crowd)

15.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
a pit hole (especially one used as a cistern or a prison)
to drip, or shed by trickling
a bisection, i.e. (by implication) the centre

16.brief: to dash in pieces, literally or figuratively (especially to disperse)
a fountain (also collectively), figuratively, a source (of satisfaction)
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors
a width, i.e. (concretely) avenue or area
a rill (i.e. small channel of water, as in irrigation)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

17.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.

18.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, something dug, i.e. a (general) source (of water, even when naturally flowing; also of tears, blood (by euphemism, of the female pudenda); figuratively, of happiness, wisdom, progeny)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
(only in plural collectively or emphatic form) youth, the state (juvenility) or the persons (young people)

19.brief: affection (in a good or a bad sense)
graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty)
the breast (as the seat of love, or from its shape)
to slake the thirst (occasionally of other appetites)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
time, especially (adverb with preposition) now, when, etc.
{affection (in a good or a bad sense)}
to stray (causatively, mislead), usually (figuratively) to mistake, especially (morally) to transgress; by extension (through the idea of intoxication) to reel, (figuratively) be enraptured
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice

20.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to stray (causatively, mislead), usually (figuratively) to mistake, especially (morally) to transgress; by extension (through the idea of intoxication) to reel, (figuratively) be enraptured
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
to clasp (the hands or in embrace)
strange, in a variety of degrees and applications (foreign, non-relative, adulterous, different, wonderful)

21.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, the front part; used adverbially (especially with preposition), opposite, in front of, forward, in behalf of
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a track (literally or figuratively); also a rampart (as circular)
properly, to roll flat, i.e. prepare (a road); also to revolve, i.e. weigh (mentally)

22.brief: to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender
to sustain; by implication, to obtain, keep fast; figuratively, to help, follow close

23.brief: he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
to stray (causatively, mislead), usually (figuratively) to mistake, especially (morally) to transgress; by extension (through the idea of intoxication) to reel, (figuratively) be enraptured
